channel.title: Problem, need someones help ( Bob Dole ? )
channel.description:
Well i made an msn client thing, its just the same as my but i wanted to maek it as a project, and well i came up against this..
I logged on and the it loaded, my account logged on msn then it said " subscript out of range "
Then i went to de bug it and this was the string it shew me.
[code]Private Sub sckMain_DataArrival(ByVal bytesTotal As Long) 'On Error Resume Next Dim sCommand As String, sData As String, sbuffer As String, sParams() As String Dim i As Long
Do Call sckMain.PeekData(sbuffer, vbString, bytesTotal)
'Check theres a full command If InStr(1, sbuffer, vbCrLf) = 0 Then Exit Sub End If
'Put the command into its own var If InStr(1, sbuffer, " ") Then sCommand = Mid$(sbuffer, 1, InStr(1, sbuffer, " ") - 1) Else sCommand = Mid$(sbuffer, 1, InStr(1, sbuffer, vbCrLf) - 1) End If
'If the command contains payload data If sCommand = "MSG" Or sCommand = "NOT" Then i = InStr(1, sbuffer, vbCrLf) sParams() = Split(Mid$(sbuffer, 1, i - 1), " ")
If CLng(Len(Mid$(sbuffer, i + 2))) < CLng(sParams(3)) Then <<< This is the line that had the problem 'The message will be sent across multiple packets Exit Do End If
sData = Mid(GetData(vbNullString, False, i + sParams(3) + 1), i + 2)
Else sData = GetData(sbuffer) sParams() = Split(sData, " ") sData = vbNullString
End If
Call ProcessData(sParams, sData)
Loop While sckMain.BytesReceived <> 0
End Sub[/code]
So can someone please tell me what to do, you will have credits in my program, please ?

item.title: Problem, need someones help ( Bob Dole ? )
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

Could you explain litte more about the error you got?

item.title: Problem, need someones help ( Bob Dole ? )
item.dc:creator: @Falko222 Falko222
item.description:
@Falko222 wrote:

Well i made an msn client thing, its just the same as my but i wanted to maek it as a project, and well i came up against thisâ€¦

I logged on and the it loaded, my account logged on msn then it said " subscript out of range "

Then i went to de bug it and this was the string it shew me.

[code]Private Sub sckMain_DataArrival(ByVal bytesTotal As Long)
'On Error Resume Next
Dim sCommand As String, sData As String, sbuffer As String, sParams() As String
Dim i As Long

Do
    Call sckMain.PeekData(sbuffer, vbString, bytesTotal)
    
    'Check theres a full command
    If InStr(1, sbuffer, vbCrLf) = 0 Then
        Exit Sub
    End If
    
    'Put the command into its own var
    If InStr(1, sbuffer, " ") Then
        sCommand = Mid$(sbuffer, 1, InStr(1, sbuffer, " ") - 1)
    Else
        sCommand = Mid$(sbuffer, 1, InStr(1, sbuffer, vbCrLf) - 1)
    End If

    'If the command contains payload data
    If sCommand = "MSG" Or sCommand = "NOT" Then
        i = InStr(1, sbuffer, vbCrLf)
        sParams() = Split(Mid$(sbuffer, 1, i - 1), " ")
        
        If CLng(Len(Mid$(sbuffer, i + 2))) < CLng(sParams(3)) Then <<< This is the line that had the problem
            'The message will be sent across multiple packets
            Exit Do
        End If
        
        sData = Mid(GetData(vbNullString, False, i + sParams(3) + 1), i + 2)

    Else
        sData = GetData(sbuffer)
        sParams() = Split(sData, " ")
        sData = vbNullString
        
    End If

    Call ProcessData(sParams, sData)

Loop While sckMain.BytesReceived <> 0

End Sub[/code]

So can someone please tell me what to do, you will have credits in my program, please ?

Read full topic
item.source: Problem, need someones help ( Bob Dole ? )
